utterances.utterance: Well, I think everybody in the world is sitting around talking about waiting out President Trump. Every secretary of state, former secretary of state, continues to meet with foreign leaders, goes to security conferences, goes around the world. We all do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: See, that's what happens when an anchor actually reads the book. So, I'm thinking holding secret meetings with a regime that's openly hostile to the American people seems a little like, what's that word? A hobby? Backstabbing? Oh, how about collusion? Yes, for two years, we've watched the media chase a phantom in an effort to undo an election. Meanwhile, Captain Corkboard here is meeting with the enemy, giving them cryptic advice on Trump. Now, you might think, how is this different from working with North Korea? Well, Kerry is not the secretary of state. It's not his job. And it might even be illegal to have an alternative foreign policy going on that's separate from the White House. Even more, it's worse to have it run from this guy in his basement in his spare time. And even when he was the secretary, who could forget his crowning achievement of international diplomacy?

utterances.speaker: JAMES TAYLOR, MUSICIAN (singing)
utterances.utterance: All you've got to do is call and I will be there. Yes, I'll be there. You've got a friend.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, when Kerry had the job, that was foreign policy. Today that might be an act of war, or just the act of an 8-year-old boy with the insecurity of a teenage girl. But taller. All right, we've got a lot of smart people here. Let's go around the table. Against the law? Logan Act? Should he go -- should -- is this treason, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Lock him up! That chant was for him, not Hillary. I think Kerry owes an apology to teenage girls, because when I was in high school, I was much more insecure than the girls that I was in the class with. I honestly think this is all about just giving CPR to his legacy, because when you think about his whole trajectory, he served honorably in Vietnam, and then he kind of tarnished that service when he came back and disparaged his fellow soldiers. Then he lost in kind of a humiliating fashion to George W. Bush. Now, a nuclear deal as secretary of state is kind of like the crown jewel for these people, especially Democrats. So Trump comes in, just rips up the piece of paper, and Kerry's left saying, "What do I have left?" So he's desperate to salvage this thing. And could you imagine if Mike Pompeo in seven and a half years, or maybe longer, goes out and tries to undermine the current Democratic presidential administration? He would get hammered by the media. I mean, you don't see Bill Clinton going down to Mexico City and trying to save NAFTA after Trump rips that up. It's unseemly, and he should be called out for it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, he does go to Mexico City but not for that. Juan, Kerry met in Paris with enemy envoys, what in 1970. He met with Daniel Ortega while Reagan was president. That was outrageous. This guy is a traitor!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Traitor, I say!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You just got it, Gregory. I'm hearing you. I'm hearing you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's swiftboating him over here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We're back to that. We're back to that. What I agree with you about is that the interviewer did a good job, Ms. Dana Perino.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We recommended questions, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was Jesse. It was Jesse. You interfered.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They wanted me to ask about John -- John Taylor. What's his name?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: James Taylor.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: James Taylor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You were going to say John Tesh.

utterances.speaker: TRISH REGAN, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Close enough, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, hey, hey, give her a break. All right. Anyway, back to the news. I think that there's a big difference to be made, distinction to be made between negotiating, and I don't think he is negotiating, and talking. And saying, which I think everybody says who's not a Trump fan, "Look, take it easy. Don't overreact. Don't get angry. Don't think that somehow this is nomination invitation now for you to go after Israel or do something else or to relaunch your nuclear program. Take it easy. Let's talk about that." I don't think there's anything criminal about that.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: He's undermining this administration. By the way, that was a great interview, and you got him to admit, "Yes, OK, I'm sort of doing this but isn't everybody doing this?" I mean, he hates this president so much, as so many on the left do. They think that they're totally fine, basically, to -- well, to use your words, commit treason. They think it's OK. They're justified, because they think there's some bigger, greater purpose that they're serving. The American people didn't know they were doing when they elected Donald Trump, he's rationalizing to himself. "I need to save the country. I need to save the people." I mean, you can go back to the anonymous article in The New York Times, right, the anonymous op-ed, where there's this sense that there's this greater good that they're somehow performing. And Kerry is part of that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. If you believe that it's evil, then everything is acceptable. Dana, do remember when everybody got upset about, during the transition, Donald Trump made some phone calls? Everybody was like, "Oh, my God."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He made the first -- he made the first phone call to Taiwan. And that was like, "Whoa, the Chinese are going to get so mad." And a lot of the neocons were like, "Yes, this is awesome. We love that." I also remember when Nancy Pelosi, during the Bush administration, Bush 43's administration, went to Syria to meet with Assad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: With a photo op and everything. Right? So treason is in the eye of the beholder. She thought she was going and being very helpful and having talks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Meanwhile, the Bush administration is having actual sanctions talk at the U.N. So there is a problem; you have to wait. It's also what Mike Flynn is accused of doing when he called Ambassador Kislyak and he talked about sanctions, which was against Obama administration policy. Could he have waited? Yes, maybe. But it's not that big a deal, because it's like two weeks later. His problem is that then he lied about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK, can I ask you a question? Did you read -- you read his book, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I read most of it. It is 600 pages. And that same weekend, I had to read Woodward's book. So I sort of felt like I was studying for finals.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd really like to make an announcement. I am now a member of Dana's book club. She invited me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's right. That's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You sound like you're having second thoughts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. No, I forgot. You can be a member.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's the first assignment? Is it a Hardy book?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He read "Fear."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm reading "Fear." I haven't finished it.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: You guys get together and talk --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have a life. I'm very busy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't. I read a novel this weekend.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Of course you did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm going to talk about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I saw a movie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What'd you see?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I saw "Mandy," the new Nicolas Cage movie. It's amazing. It's like being trapped in a heavy metal song with demons.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That sounds horrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's fantastic. No, it's great.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I had a better time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What did you --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I went to see Paul Simon. I was, like, the youngest person there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You've seen ZZ Top and Paul Simon. Man, Juan, you're getting around.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What did you do, Trish?

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: I had an amazing, amazing weekend. I'm actually going to talk about it later.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a tease.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a "One More Thing" tease.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. President Trump set to declassify key FISA documents. The breaking news, next. Wait!

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: This is a FOX News alert. President Trump declassifying key FISA documents related to the Russia investigation. The president also authorizing the release of text messages from James Comey, Andrew McCabe, Peter Strzok, Lisa Page, and Bruce Ohr. The exact release date is not yet known. But Jesse, it sounds like we're going to read all those texts. My goodness. And even James Comey in there, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I might have to put down "Fear" and pick up the texts. So I mean, this has been a long time coming, and people have been asking the president to do this for almost a year. And I'm glad he's doing it before the midterms, because it is going to have a huge political impact. Right now, the -- you know, looks like the Democrats have a very good shot at retaking the House. If this all comes out and people can see that a lot of what's been going on in terms of surveillance and the special counsel was rigged from the jump and people were corrupt to the very highest levels when it came to political persecution and things that should never have been done. And I think people are going to take a very hard look at that and say, "You know what? I'm able to discount a lot of the drama and a lot of the -- the court filings and things like that in the investigations," and that's important for the American people to see.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: How quickly, Dana, do you think the American people will be able to see it? Like, what's the process?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, because it's -- people have been asking, not just people but, like, The Wall Street Journal editorial board. Like, "Why don't we just release these documents?" This has been going back for about a year. It could be that the Justice Department and the FBI and the White House are all comfortable with these being released momentarily. But it might take them a day or two just to figure out if they need any other sources to be dealt with. I also wonder if this is a sign that things are starting to wrap up, because now you have Manafort's plea. You know, there's movement. And to me, this feels like another way to wrap this up.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: Greg, do you think the president knows or has any inkling what exactly is in there? I mean, I think we all are somewhat suspicious, given what we have seen. But why is he doing this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I spoke to him this morning at length over -- at the omelet station at Applebee's, and he told me, you know, "We'll wait and see what happens." I can't say much else. My mike came off. But the one big story is the story that didn't happen, which is the collusion story. I mean, if you look at the book "Fear," was there anything in there? He couldn't find it. He tried.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He also defends President Trump in his book.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And he did at the time, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The Peter Strzok texts reveal that there was no evidence of collusion at the time they handed the thing off to the special counsel.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Could this collusion investigation be the biggest -- the biggest scandal in the history of mankind?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I thought you were going to go with "witch hunt."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're on the wild-goose chase for two years. Everybody should be arrested, including Juan Williams. I'm pressing charges against that tie.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't like it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm not sure I do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You hurt my feelings. All right. But anyway, I think, like Dana was saying, could be wrapped up. Also, could be an indication of a flailing president, because people have been asking on the conservative side of the Trump team, saying -- Devin Nunes has been the lead cheerleader for this, right, because he thinks it's going to embarrass somebody in the intelligence community. So I think the president was somewhat restrained in saying, "Hey, listen, we can't just throw a FISA warrant out there, because FISA warrants are secret for a reason. You don't want your enemies to know about your sources." But now after the Manafort flip, and Manafort is going to apparently cooperate with Mueller. And then you have, in addition, I think it's now we're up to, like, twenty- something people who've been either charged or pled guilty to charges brought by Robert Mueller.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No collusion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think that you have a president who is desperate.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Don't you think --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Desperate for the truth. Desperate for transparency.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Oh, yes, he is a guy who's never told a lie. I think he set a record the other day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who's counting?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The Washington Post.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you, Juan, as a journalist, I want to know what caused them to go get that FISA warrant. I mean, other than this --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dossier.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: -- dossier, which was funded by political operatives on the other side. I mean, Jesse, I think the American people want to know what really happened. By the way, we deserve to know, whatever it is. We deserve to know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Listen, if it comes out that the dossier made up 90 percent of this warrant application, and that's all they had, then that's a huge scandal. And if more text messages come out from Bruce Ohr and McCabe and Strzok and Page that show this thing started on the left with the Clinton team and then was funneled back door through the DOJ and into the FBI, and at the end of the day, they really had nothing hard to go along with any collusion, it looks like a huge hit piece against the Trump campaign, illegal hit piece. And then it looks like a big cover up for the last year and a half.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How do you guys feel about that football player quitting at halftime?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I feel -- I think it was really bad sportsmanship.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because they were losing. You don't quit when you're losing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. You always quit when you're ahead.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, I'm out of here.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: Not yet. We've got "One More Thing" coming up next. I'm with you. You don't quit midstream. All thought. "One More Thing" next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "One More Thing." I'll go first. This last Friday. FOX News's very own Chris Wallace got an aware. It's the Tex McCrary Award for journalism awarded by the Congressional Medal of Honor society at its annual convention. The ceremony happened the day after Chris hosted a panel discussion with three Medal of Honor recipients. During his speech, Chris highlighted the relationship FOX News and military families share.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS WALLACE, FOX NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: I am honored to receive this award, especially from people I respect so greatly. I'm grateful you recognize the work of our "FOX News Sunday" team these past 15 years, telling your story. We understand the military and their families are a big part of our FOX audience.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dana, did you just get -- you got this award last year.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I did get that award before. But it was aspirational. Chris Wallace is certainly much more accomplished than I am.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, stop.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Speaking of accomplished journalists, I'll go now. The -- do you guys remember when you started to learn how to drive, and you either had your father take you out for a spin or your uncle or something like that? Or a professional.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Your mom could do that, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Or your mom. Sometimes things go well, and sometimes they don't. Here is an incident that happened in Maryland during a driving lesson.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Someone was teaching someone to park in a parking lot at a swimming pool, and they wound up in the swimming pool. They both escaped unharmed and swam to the shore. And I guess they had to pull the car out of the pool. And I would not give this guy a license, or girl. We don't know. We don't know who it was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Talk about a carpool. Shoot me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That was great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You get to go next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Let's do this.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: Greg's New TV Show News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Greg's New TV Show News." All right. I've been pitching this show all around cable, and finally, they did it. It's called "Cat and Owl Staring at You for an Hour. That's what it's called. It's just an hour. See the little owl? And see the cat? All they do is stare at you for one hour. This is going to rate; it's going to be big. Big, I tell you. Look at this. I've been watching this for days now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The cat's so scared. She's like, "Can I get in here?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But isn't that wonderful? If a cat and an owl can stay together like that, why can't Democrats and Republicans? And liberals and conservatives? Huh? If they can do it. By the way, after this show, the cat actually bit the head off the owl.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was disgusting.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, you've got to get a new cat or owl, I guess. Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Doesn't matter.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So I learned a new word today, and I bet you don't know what it means. The word is spy hop. So I'm going to show you what it means. Watch this video.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's three humpback whales breaching the service of the waters off Tiverton, Nova Scotia, last month. The incredible video as shot from a tour ship after the three humpback whales spent some time near the boat, lolling around. They then seemed to disappear, but within minutes they took turns jumping out of the water, creating the incredible display that you're seeing. So what does spy hop mean? Well, a spy hop is whenever an animal jumps out of the water to get a better view of the activity near the water's surface. It's like, you know, when your goldfish jumps out of the tank so he can see what's happening in the living room. That's a spy hop.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think the screaming would annoy me to no end.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The screaming of the tourists?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, that's probably why the whales are, like, going crazy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, it's the same thing in your living room when the goldfish jumps out.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Trish, save us.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: Well, I told you I was going to tell you about my weekend.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: I got a call on Saturday, and I was so happy when I heard. So I have a little sister I'm very, very close to, my sister Caitlin. We've always been close, and we're so close now we, like, talk almost every day. And she plays a big role in my children's lives now. Really, they just -- the sun just rises and sets on her. They are crazy about Caitlin. And Caitlin met a great guy six months ago. And we got -- his name is Chris. And we got a call. They were in Barcelona, Spain, and my mom and I were walking down the street together, and we got this call. They're engaged!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I did not see that coming.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: And I was so happy I actually started crying. And my mom started crying. And --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Happy tears are the best.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: Welcome to the family, Chris. Caitlin, we --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's not very attractive, though.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: They're so happy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Looked like they met on "The Bachelor." God, good-looking people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Can you just let her celebrate for a minute?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We can't let anything sentimental go.

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: Caitlin, you look way more like you should work here than me. I know. She's a beautiful girl and a wonderful girl. It will be great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Where do they live?

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.utterance: New Hampshire, but probably Connecticut soon.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Connecticut.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Home address?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Don't ever give your home address to Greg. All right. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next. Hey, Bret.
